subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] More linear tuning... continued.
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Yeah, that's clear. I've notivced that too, when I have one of the boxes not 
working, the voices seem better, but they tend to be this type, it's like a 
different level comes in.

  Frank



>From: " RetroCom" <vfp19968@...>
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] More linear tuning... continued.
>Date: Thu, 29 Mar 2007 03:26:20 -0700
>
>Nice work Frank. Interesting how the technique can produce results even 
>under less then ideal conditions. I've been finding several messages in 
>reverse playback with the simple 'dial spin'. Here's one example.
>"We love you mortals"  (Almost like it was sung)
>Dave
>
>--- franks-boxes@... wrote:
>
>From: "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@...>
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [EVP-ITC] More linear tuning... continued.
>Date: Wed, 28 Mar 2007 20:26:38 -0600
>
>More from the second session. There's no echo box with this, and I'm using
>only the built in mic on the recorder. I didn't have quite the right
>varactors, so the tuning wasn't very good, and didn't cover the whole band.
>I think if I use this with one of the home made tuners, designed for 
>voltage
>tuning, it might be alot better.
>
>Frank
